page.title: 16A Local Personality cont.
page.content: Severn Beach had a fun fair, the Blue Lagoon built about 1933 and a boating lake where common grassland now is near rugby pitch. It was a popular place to visit from Bristol. Severn Beach was named by Mr and Mrs Britton of Severn Beach Farm when first map was made. In 1910 high tides drove them out. In the 1930's people came to Severn Beach in caravans for weekends. Some liked it and stayed permanently. Caravan parks are a feature and make up about 20% of the population. The old Avonmouth to Aust Road went through the village. New coast road took all through traffic away. Mr Ball went to our school and left at 14, was a scout, enjoyed cricket, and football in his spare time.
